column4: having an issue with cdrecord and cpu usage... any help please?
best to just ask your question...
tnx... while using cdrecord the cpu usage (i see it in the applet system monitor) increases until it reaches 100%
what cpu do you have?
a celeron 500... but I used previously cdrecord without problems in debian... got this problem when i switched to ubuntu
I guess DMA is being disabled on your cd burner.
do u know how to enable it please?
try "hdparm -c3 /dev/cdrom", then burning something
tnx, I'll try immediately
it was a cdrom DMA problem... now it works perfectly... tnx so much i was really upset :-)
no problem
do u help in the #debian channel too?
yes

tonight I was searching for help in the debian channel and when i said i was using ubuntu they treated me like an idiot... it was a very unpleasant experience...  i was sure thi sproblem was a generic one and not just an ubuntu issue
yes, asking for help with non-Debian distributions in #debian is strongly discouraged
if you want help with a particular distribution, ask for help in that distribution's channel
you gave me the answer without asking me anything... I think you knew the solution to my problem.. they did not... and they found easier to offend me
well, it gets very very tiresome when people keep asking questions about things other than Debian
i think they did not know the asnwer... it would have been more correct to tell me: sorry we do not know
but you would have been more correct to ask in here instead of there
:-) i tried but i could not get an answer here at that time... anyway now it's ok and thank you so much again
np
